solution_line_template: The total cost for the flour is {num_boxes_flour} x ${cost_per_box_flour} = $<<{num_boxes_flour}*{cost_per_box_flour}={total_cost_flour}>>{total_cost_flour}.
The total cost of the tray of eggs is {num_trays_eggs} x ${cost_per_tray_eggs} = $<<{num_trays_eggs}*{cost_per_tray_eggs}={total_cost_eggs}>>{total_cost_eggs}.
The total cost for the liter of milk is {num_liters_milk} x ${cost_per_liter_milk} = $<<{num_liters_milk}*{cost_per_liter_milk}={total_cost_milk}>>{total_cost_milk}.

The total cost for the box of baking soda is {num_boxes_baking_soda} x ${cost_per_box_baking_soda} = $<<{num_boxes_baking_soda}*{cost_per_box_baking_soda}={total_cost_baking_soda}>>{total_cost_baking_soda}.

Therefore, the total cost for all the ingredients is ${total_cost_flour} + ${total_cost_eggs} + ${total_cost_milk} + ${total_cost_baking_soda} = $<<{total_cost_flour}+{total_cost_eggs}+{total_cost_milk}+{total_cost_baking_soda}={total_cost_all_ingredients}>>{total_cost_all_ingredients}.
